Package view

Class NotesView

java.lang.Object
view.NotesView
All Implemented Interfaces:
Observer
public class NotesView extends Object implements Observer
The NotesView class implements the Observer interface and serves as the graphical user interface for a notes application. It provides functionalities for creating, displaying, and managing notes through a user-friendly interface.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    JButton
    addNoteButton
    Button to add a new note to the application.
    boolean
    isFullScreen
    Flag indicating whether the application is in full-screen mode.
    JTextArea
    noteTextArea
    Text area where the content of the current note is displayed and can be edited by the user.

  • Field Details

    • noteTextArea

      public JTextArea noteTextArea
      Text area where the content of the current note is displayed and can be edited by the user.

    • addNoteButton

      public JButton addNoteButton
      Button to add a new note to the application.

    • isFullScreen

      public boolean isFullScreen
      Flag indicating whether the application is in full-screen mode.

  • Constructor Details

    • NotesView

      public NotesView()
      Constructs the NotesView. It initializes the user interface components and sets up the necessary interactions.

  • Method Details

    • setController

      public void setController(NotesController controller)
      Sets the controller for this view. This allows the view to communicate with the controller when actions occur in the GUI. It also attaches this view as an observer to the model through the controller.
      Parameters:
      controller - The NotesController that controls the application logic.

    • display

      public void display()
      Makes the application frame visible to the user. This method is intended to be called after all UI components have been initialized and added to the frame. It ensures that the frame is properly displayed on the screen.

    • setAddNoteActionListener

      public void setAddNoteActionListener(ActionListener listener)
      Registers an ActionListener for the "Add Note" button. This listener is triggered when the user interacts with the button, allowing for custom behavior such as opening a dialog to add a new note.
      Parameters:
      listener - The ActionListener to be attached to the "Add Note" button.

    • setExitTouchScreenModeActionListener

      public void setExitTouchScreenModeActionListener(ActionListener listener)
      Registers an ActionListener for the button that exits touch screen mode. This listener is responsible for handling the transition from touch screen mode back to the standard interface mode.
      Parameters:
      listener - The ActionListener to be attached to the exit touch screen mode button.

    • getNoteText

      public String getNoteText()
      Retrieves the current text from the note text area.
      Returns:
      String The text currently contained in the note text area.

    • clearNoteText

      public void clearNoteText()
      Clears the text from the note text area, resetting it to an empty state.

    • disableTouchScreenMode

      public void disableTouchScreenMode()
      Disables touch-screen mode by reverting UI elements to their original sizes for normal mouse and keyboard interaction. This includes resetting the font size of the JTextArea to its original size and hiding the exit touch screen mode button.

    • displayNotes

      public void displayNotes(List<String> notes)
      Displays a list of notes in the note text area. This method is useful for showing multiple notes at once, separated by new lines.
      Parameters:
      notes - A list of strings, each representing a note to be displayed.

    • enableTouchScreenMode

      public void enableTouchScreenMode()
      Enables touch-screen mode by enlarging UI elements and adjusting their visibility for easier interaction on touch-based devices. This mode enhances accessibility and usability in touch screen environments.

    • toggleFullScreen

      public void toggleFullScreen()
      Toggles the application window between full-screen and windowed mode. This method allows the user to switch between different display modes for their preference or convenience.

    • getFrame

      public JFrame getFrame()
      Provides access to the main application frame.
      Returns:
      JFrame The main application frame.

    • displayNotesDialog

      public void displayNotesDialog()
      Displays a dialog containing all notes in a scrollable text area. This method provides a convenient way to view all notes at once, enhancing the user's ability to browse and manage their notes.

    • applyTheme

      public void applyTheme(mdlaf.themes.MaterialTheme theme)
      Applies the selected theme to the application, updating the look and feel accordingly. This method also logs the application of the new theme.
      Parameters:
      theme - the MaterialTheme object representing the new theme to apply

    • update

      public void update()
      Notifies the UI to update based on changes in the underlying model. This method ensures that the view reflects the current state of the application, such as displaying the latest notes or applying new settings.
      Specified by:
      update in interface Observer
